data_maturity_score.evidence: IBM is a large enterprise with established data practices, mentions modern cloud platforms (AWS, Google, Azure) and ETL tools, but focus on legacy BI tools like Cognos suggests mature but not cutting-edge practices

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 4 indicates managed level - IBM has established data governance, quality practices, and modern tooling integration, typical for large enterprise consulting environments

maturity_signals.evidence: Mentions multiple cloud platforms (AWS, Google, Azure) as preferred experience, and IBM's consulting delivery centers suggest established governance practices

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined BI engineer role focused on Cognos development, reporting, and data warehouse projects - no mixing of unrelated responsibilities like ML, DevOps, or backend development

overtime_risk_score.evidence: IBM Consulting roles often involve client delivery pressure, tight deadlines, and project-based work which can lead to longer hours, especially in delivery centers

role_clarity.evidence: Very specific role focused on Cognos BI development, reporting, visualization, and data warehouse projects with clear technical requirements and responsibilities

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - well-defined role at established company but consulting delivery pressure and location restriction are notable concerns

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No specific manager or reporting structure mentioned, only refers to 'business and technical members of the team' in general terms

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No mention of manager level, reporting structure, or leadership hierarchy in the job description

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No mention of team expansion, hiring velocity, or growth plans in the job posting

value.seniority_mix: mix of business and technical members

team_composition.evidence: Mentions working with 'business and technical members of the team' but no specific team size or composition details provided

reporting_structure.evidence: No specific reporting structure, manager title, or organizational hierarchy mentioned in the job description

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Role appears to be within IBM Consulting delivery centers working on client projects rather than embedded in cross-functional product teams

work_life_balance_score.evidence: IBM Consulting delivery center roles often involve client delivery pressure, project deadlines, and consulting hours which can impact work-life balance

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No mention of career growth, learning opportunities, mentorship, or advancement paths - role appears focused on delivery rather than development

tech_culture_score.evidence: Mixed signals - mentions modern cloud platforms but focuses heavily on legacy BI tools like Cognos, no mention of modern engineering practices

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source contributions, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time in the job description

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No mention of code review, CI/CD, testing practices, monitoring, or other modern development practices

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintenance and support of existing reporting systems, root cause analysis, and evolutionary maintenance suggests limited innovation opportunities

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of modernizing systems, reducing technical debt, or improving code quality - focus is on maintaining existing Cognos environments

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of AI, ML, machine learning, or any AI/ML tools in the job description - purely focused on traditional BI and reporting

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned - role is focused on traditional BI tools like Cognos for reporting and visualization

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgent language like 'immediate start' or 'ASAP' - appears to be standard IBM hiring process for consulting delivery center

competition_level.evidence: IBM is a well-known company, role requires specific Cognos skills which may limit candidate pool, but location in Pune may reduce competition compared to major tech hubs

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a large, established enterprise company with global consulting operations and delivery centers

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting typically has steady hiring for delivery centers to support various client projects

team_size_signals.evidence: No specific team size mentioned in the job description

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded, established enterprise company

role_creation_type.evidence: Consulting delivery centers typically expand teams based on client demand and project requirements

strength_details: IBM is a stable, established enterprise with global presence and consulting expertise
Clear BI engineer role focused on Cognos development and data warehouse projects
Specific technical requirements make it clear what skills are needed
concern_details: No salary, benefits, or compensation information disclosed
No career growth, learning opportunities, or advancement path mentioned
IBM Consulting delivery center roles often involve long hours and client delivery pressure
Location restricted to Pune, India with no remote work options
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers with 3-5 years experience in BI and reporting
Candidates with Cognos experience looking for stable enterprise roles
Engineers seeking traditional BI focus rather than modern data engineering
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand typical work hours and overtime expectations in consulting delivery
Inquire about career progression and growth opportunities within IBM
Ask about team structure and reporting relationships
leverage_details: Strong Cognos development and administration skills are specific and valuable
Already located in Pune, Maharashtra, India - no relocation needed
summary.overall_assessment: Stable enterprise BI role at IBM with clear technical focus on Cognos and data warehouse projects. Good for candidates seeking traditional BI work at established company. Main concerns are lack of compensation transparency, limited growth opportunities, and consulting delivery pressure. Location restriction to Pune may limit candidate pool.
